medical_history.chief_complaint: Rash on the left cheek and additional reddish-brown papules on the body.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 3 months of age with a red, slightly raised lesion on the left cheek which grew slowly. Approximately 1 week before evaluation, additional reddish-brown papules appeared on the forehead and then spread to other parts of the body. The cheek lesion regressed over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born healthy; negative evaluation for ureteral reflux about 31/2 months before this visit. Mother had a history of mild eczema and onychomycosis.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal family history of breast and bladder cancer, and a maternal first cousin died from the VATER complex. Paternal family history of diabetes mellitus and breast cancer. Father had no skin conditions.
medical_history.social_history: Diet consisted of breast milk, formula, and solids added 3 weeks before presentation. No significant lifestyle factors mentioned.
